title: Trump to Finalize Trade Deals by August 1, Commerce Secretary Announces
description: President Donald Trump is expected to finalize trade deal decisions with the European Union and China by August 1, 2025, focusing on issues like steel and aluminum tariffs and digital services regulations.

title: DOJ Seeks Voter Data from 19 States Amid Election Integrity Efforts
description: The DOJ has initiated requests for voter registration data and election records from at least 19 states, aiming to enhance federal oversight of elections. This move has raised concerns among state officials about privacy and federal overreach.

title: Investigation Launched into Ex-Trump Prosecutor Jack Smith\'s Actions
description: The Office of Special Counsel is investigating Jack Smith, the former special counsel who led cases against Donald Trump, to determine if he violated the Hatch Act by engaging in political activity while serving as a federal employee.

title: EPA Plans Workforce Reductions Amid Ongoing Legal Challenges
description: The Environmental Protection Agency is proceeding with planned workforce reductions in the Office of Environmental Justice and External Civil Rights, despite ongoing legal challenges. These layoffs are scheduled to take effect on July 31, unless new legal actions intervene.

title: Supreme Court order lists for August 2025
description: The U.S. Supreme Court released its order lists for August 2025, detailing the cases it will hear and the decisions it has made. These orders provide insight into the Court\'s upcoming docket and the legal issues it will address in the coming term.

title: Democrats Propose Ban on Corporate PACs
description: A group of congressional Democrats introduced a proposal to ban for-profit corporations from forming and utilizing political action committees (PACs), aiming to reduce corporate influence in politics. This initiative addresses concerns over the role of money in elections and may reignite internal party debates ahead of the 2028 elections.

title: Surge in Big Tech Lobbying to Influence AI Policy
description: Between January and June 2025, over 500 organizations lobbied the U.S. government on artificial intelligence (AI), reflecting a surge in efforts to influence AI policy under the Trump administration. Leading firms like OpenAI, Google, Microsoft, Amazon, and Meta significantly increased their lobbying budgets to shape favorable policies and secure government support for AI infrastructure.
